Question
========

From each of two normally distributed populations with equal variances a sample is drawn.______________. Sample 1: n = 10, mean = 31, sd = 12.77 Sample 2: n = 10, mean = 41, sd = 3.91. The pooled variance estimator takes the value 89.18. It is tested whether the population averages are equal. The corresponding test size follows, if the null hypothesis is TRUE,

Answerlist
----------

* An F-distribution with 10 and 10 degrees of freedom
* A T distribution with 18 degrees of freedom
* An F-division with 9 and 9 degrees of freedom
* A T distribution with 20 degrees of freedom

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* An F-distribution with 10 and 10 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
* A T-division with 18 degrees of freedom: Correct
* An F-division with 9 and 9 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
* A T-division with 20 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
